column5: Have to agree with Musky 66 1/2 ounce white and chartreuse  spinnerbait. Slow roll , burn, fish thru cover...... TJ I hope  your not using thsoe lures and only collecting them!
1/2 oz Kastmaster silver spoon with dressed treble. Jig it, cast it, troll it.

If it were a matter of life and death and I had to catch fish for food - Jig and GULP Twister tail as most others suggested!  But for flat out fun - I'd bring an x-rap!  I love fishin' them.  I have way to short of an attention span for twister tails, tubes, etc.  no doubt they catch fish, but I need to keep moving!  Cheers, UF
Here's a guy that knows what he is talkin' about...
Black RoadRunner Jig  http://www.shootnhunt.com/catalog/JM/jigs_..._jig/index.html
Heddon Tiny Torpedo

If I only had one lure, and I assume no replacements, I would go for something durable like a spoon. Catches fish, and can take a beating on rocks or from fish bites.  Every other kind of lure in my tacklebox gets worn or chewed up, esp by pike or muskie. Have several crankbaits that have puncture marks, spinnerbait skirts get torn up, and plastics get torn up pretty quickly too.  Mike

Only one lure eh?...hmmmmm.......I would have to go with a cotton cordell super spot lipless crank. I've caught drum, catfish, muskie, pike, walleye, perch, bass, crappie, even trout on the smaller sizes, and salmon. I always have one ready to go every time I go out, even through the ice.

One Lure........mine would be an oversized Tube. They seem to attract every type of fish imaginable. Even fish that are half its size. Either a Tiger Tube or Waterwolf. As for color, smoke or grey with fleck.  My luck, I would probably loose it the first cast though and be stuck sitting there
Various sized jigs a bucket of minnows, can't loose, or a worm harness is hard to beat.
Besides my own lures - I'd take a #4 Mepps Black Fury with yellow dots - it catches everything!
I think this is the GCD pattern..

Mepps Black Fury dressed or Mepps Brown Trout dressed. Both #3 or #4, preferably #4.  The Brown Trout is difficult to find in the Hamilton area. If anyone has seen it in the local tackle shops the heads up is appreciated.
spin doctor and fly
Jig + twister, that's simple.
As Solopaddler has shown me up at his place in Quebec, you can't go wrong with a jig on a new body of water... The results are delicious on a shore lunch  .
I did not even think of the worn harness duh! Yup should have chose it but that's ok I will stick with the spinnerbait :-)
Live bait.  Can I have more than one minnow or worm though...?
Yer don't bring worms on a survival trip, you dig 'em.

For an all purpose utility lure I would have to say a little cleo. Unlike many of the other choices it works on most species, can be fished throughout the water column, and more importantly can be chucked a good distance accurately. In my mind a wormharness doesn't count because it uses live bait.

Instead of a simple favourite lure debate, I'm picturing this as a survival situation. One bait to save your life... The spoon is good. The crankbait is too. The jig is super, and any type of spinner, whether it's in-line or bent into a spinnerbait would be a sound choice most of the time. But if you have to put fish on the table and you don't know what you will be fishing for, I would chose a fly. Something mid-size, like a muddler minnow or a woolly worm. They will catch any fish that swims and you can use a tree branch and a piece of string as your rod and line. Garry2rs
Without a doubt a jig of some sort-jigs will catch fish in any situation.
Spinnerbait or buzzbait. Love the hits you get. On a side note if I had to pick one bait, chicken livers.
Absolutely. You can fish it horizontal or vertical. Fast or slow. Deep or shallow.

If we are talking survival one lure fishing, then where did the boat come from?   A jig is nice if you have a boat. If you are tossing from shore and distance or accuracy is a requirement, I'd much rather fish with a little cleo.

Dark Jointed floating Rapala, Size depending on Species.  Fishing in snags and weeds, it has the best chance for not hooking up.  Great Trolling lure.  Oh you want to fish deep, or cast farther add a sinker.  Does not twist my line.  Only one problem.  You have to bring extra trebles to replace the broken ones from the predetor fish strikes.  As far as Carp fishing, as useless as teats on a Bull.  Then again, Carp is not a sport fish as it is a transplanted mistake.
Tubes....Colour: Smoke.
I don't understand why you can't get distance and accuracy from shore with a jig.
Nice Catch

....The origional question asks "If you had to pick one lure, For a trip? (To take with you on a fishing trip what would it be?)"  Now I don't know about the rest of you but when I take a "fishing trip" I generally take my boat and I always have plenty of jigs.
mepps black fury! ( #5 )

Bucktail jig. Almost a toss-up with the white grub, but I figure the tail on the white curly-tail would be gone after a few fish. You don't need a boat to fish a jig anymore than you do any other lure. Oh, and live bait isn't a lure anymore than a hooker is a girlfriend.
....Hey, that ain't green!
Oooooo!... but it's effective!!!!
Ask me to restrict to one lure?  I'd go with a 3" white curly tail grub on a safety pin harness with a silver spinner blade.
i'll pick an oversized spoon maybe a 7",  if it doesnt catch fish i'll use it to dig for worms, bugs, larvae...
a 6 inch woodie in perch white belly. i normally only fish muskies
A chartreuse 1 1/2 ounce spinner bait I make myself- only fish for Musky nowadays- and it is tops!

One lure for a trip? I would probably stay home, I like to be prepared and one lure doesn`t give me the best chance for a good trip. Lure of choice on trips is a jig and pig, jig and worm, tube jig, jig jig jig, great lure, not always the best for the situation.
To take with you on a fishing trip what would it be? Hopefully this has not been covered before  Mine would be a spinnerbait hoping for pike :-)
For me it would have to be a jig without a doubt.
jig white twister tail
If I had no idea what was in the water then I'd have to agree with Peter...jig with white twister tail. I'd also bring along some real worms.
Only one lure eh.. It would have to be my go-to lure, the lure I can never go on a fishing trip without, my Berkley white/silver top-popper.. what a great lure..
1/4 ounce jig and twister white or black . buck tail instead of twister if i only had one as the twister will get ripped where the bucktail would last longer
What he said.......
Cotton Cordell Ripplin Red Fin (Chrome Blue or black) I actually do make sure I have one in my van, my quad and my boat. It's not the most durable lure, but it does produce.
Ya it`s been covered numerous times but I would take a jig if Walleye was the target and a Senko for everything else.  I haven`t caught a Walleye on a Senko yet. Note to self try a Senko next spring.

Well without a doubt it would have to be a....... WORM HARNESS....!!!!!!!     or at the very least  hooks & dew worms....that will catch anything that swims,no doubt about it,and its the most versitile bait ever,in the history of fishing....cheers
We shall see in Quinte next week
That would be my choice.
definately a jig
chatterbait... wicked actoin, catach both bass and pike, never thought of pickerals.. maybe i'll try at quinte? haha
Jumla
SR5 Crawdad Shad Rap
Is there a difference between worms and wormsicles?  JF
Now don't take this the wrong way.... but all lures are crap compared to this one...    Lucky Strike SUPERFLASH... Ive caught Pickeral, bass, trout, salmon, perch AND Muskie on them!!
A rattling Storm Chug Bug for topwater baby!
Oh Oh... ya  ... I should have said Jumla... (Thanks Gerritt...)
LOL
Heddon Zara Spook Jr.
Rapala Original
....Yep, white twister tail jig here too. I can work it any where in the water column (cast it, troll it or jig it) and it'll catch the attention of everything finned.

Well biteme,as for as we will see next week....the bay of quinte is where the worm harness shines my man !!!!! ive caught tons of walleyes down there with my homeade harnesses,and back in 96 i won a walleye tournament using one of my harnesses,when almost nothing else was working,like mepps,rapalas,minnows,jigs,big cranks like reef runners & manns....and i have almost caught everything except,an atlantic salmon on them....ive caught sturgeon,channel cats salmon,trout,lakers,muskies,big smallies,largies,whitefish,crappies,pike,and cod in the atlantic ocean,when you put a dew worm on those things ,they will catch everything & anything....and they are the most versitile of any lure...cause you can fish em any way and everyway......they are simply the ULTIMATE LURE.....cheers
